learning_outcomes.description: Identify and describe the clinical features, behaviours and characteristics of adults and children with swallowing disorders (Professional Standards 1.3, 1.5, 2.5, 2.6, 3.2, 3.3)
Describe assessments to evaluate the swallowing skills of adults and children (Professional Standards 1.1, 1.5, 3.2)
Analyse and interpret assessment data to differentially diagnose adults and children with swallowing disorders (Professional Standards  1.1, 1.3, 2.5, 2.6, 3.3)
Analyse and integrate data to develop client and family-centred management plans for swallowing disorders in adults and children (Professional Standards 1.1, 1.3, 1.4, 2.2, 2.5, 2.6, 3.3, 3.4)
Identify, describe, and implement a range of intervention approaches used in the management of swallowing disorders in adults and children (Professional Standards 1.1, 1.3, 1.5, 2.5, 2.6, 3.4)
Monitor and evaluate the progress of adults and children with swallowing disorders and modify interventions in line with these needs (Professional Standards 1.3, 2.2, 2.5, 3.4)

assessments.due_date:
22/08/2024 7:00 pm

This exam will be completed in Inspera with access using a link provided in the Blackboard course site. The exam will be made available for completion from 8:00am to 7:00pm on Thursday 22nd August 2024. Students will have 60 minutes to complete the exam within this timeframe. Students may only attempt to complete the exam once.
assessments.task_description: This mid-semester exam will assess content covered in lectures during Weeks 1 - 4 of the semester. Questions will be made up of a mix of multiple choice, multiple-response , in-line choice, matching/pairing, hotspot, and inline gap match questions.  This is an online, non-invigilated assessment.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Examination will automatically submit after allocated time or due time has elapsed.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.late_submission: Exams submitted after the end of the submission time will incur a late penalty.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.

assessments.due_date:
17/09/2024

This examination will be held during the normal Tuesday lecture time slot in week 9 of semester and will be an on-campus, invigilated, paper-based exam.
assessments.task_description: The final examination will assess content covered through out the semester. This includes Adult Dysphagia, Paediatric Dysphagia, Tracheostomy Management and Head and Neck Cancer. The final examination will case based information and short answer questions.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.late_submission: Late submission of assessment items will attract a penalty of 10% of the mark per day late or, for work graded on a 1-7 scale, a deduction of one grade per day (including weekends and public holidays), unless a formal extension has been organised prior to the due date and time.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.

assessments.task_description:
In this assignment, students are provided with case information and case data for an adult or paediatric dysphagia case. Students can select which case they complete their assignment on. Students are required to 1) introduce the case they have selected and present the relevant case information and research literature regarding the client’s medical diagnosis and presenting feeding/swallowing disorder; 2) integrate the available information and assessment results to provide a diagnostic summary; 3) outline their recommendations and management plan supported by an integration of case information and research literature; 4) develop an educational handout/resource to support the family’s learning. 

Case data will be released in week 5 of semester.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Assignments to be submitted via TurnItIn with an SHRS coversheet included.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: Late submission of assessment items will attract a penalty of 10% of the mark per day late or, for work graded on a 1-7 scale, a deduction of one grade per day (including weekends and public holidays), unless a formal extension has been organised prior to the due date and time.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

learning_activities.topic:
Adult Dysphagia

Series of lectures that regarding an introduction to swallowing disorders, understanding the normal swallow, alternations to the normal swallow, dysphagia therapy, clinical evaluation of swallowing, instrumental assessment of swallowing, clinical decision making and reporting, and interviewing.
learning_activities.topic_description: Adult Dysphagia Series of lectures that regarding an introduction to swallowing disorders, understanding the normal swallow, alternations to the normal swallow, dysphagia therapy, clinical evaluation of swallowing, instrumental assessment of swallowing, clinical decision making and reporting, and interviewing.

learning_activities.topic:
Paediatric Dysphagia

Series of lectures regarding typical feeding development and assessment of paediatric dysphagia.
learning_activities.topic_description: Paediatric Dysphagia Series of lectures regarding typical feeding development and assessment of paediatric dysphagia.

learning_activities.topic:
Dysphagia simulation learning activities

Students will participate in interactive simulations in weeks 5 and 7 of the semester. These practicals will provide students with an opportunity to further develop clinical skills in the management of adults and children with dysphagia.
learning_activities.topic_description: Dysphagia simulation learning activities Students will participate in interactive simulations in weeks 5 and 7 of the semester. These practicals will provide students with an opportunity to further develop clinical skills in the management of adults and children with dysphagia.
